title: (16003) Cuenca - 1 Calle Antonio Maura

title: (16003) Cuenca - 10 Pasaje Antonio Maura
description: A place to park and visit Cuenca, possibility to spend the night, quiet place. Slightly sloping. Park in the evening because in the morning many cars invade the space. Quiet and quiet despite the proximity of the railway. No service.

title: (16003) Cuenca - 2 Calle Juan Martino

title: (16002) Cuenca - 5 Avenida los Alfares
description: Parking day and night next to the football field. Without services

title: (16002) Cuenca - 10 Calle Presa Cerdán

title: (16002) Cuenca - 1 Calle Sargal

title: (16004) Cuenca - 2 Calle de los Hermanos Becerril

title: (16004) Cuenca - 11 Ronda de San José

title: (16002) Cuenca - 27 Paseo del Jucar
description: Free street parking with a water fountain nearby for filling up by water carrier. Ideally placed for the St Julien walk, as well as the castle area and cathedral. Lovely walks along the river too. Not suited for a vehicle over 6 meters.

title: (16002) Cuenca - 5 Bajada Angustias
description: Large area next to the Júcar river and below the beautiful city of Cuenca. With trees and nice walks along the river side.

title: (16001) Cuenca - 4 Paseo del Huécar
description: Hard standing parking. Toilet at top entrance to underground parking. Payment made to attendant in underground park, possible chain across entrance which attendant will remove. Short walk into old town.

title: (16002) Cuenca - Unnamed Road
description: Parking lot at the cemetery, ideal for cycling to the historic city center. No prohibitions, absolutely quiet, flat, paved. Garbage can, otherwise no supply. Supermarket nearby

title: (16004) Cuenca - C. del Rio Gritos
description: Day-only parking for motorhomes of the Paleontological Museum of Castilla la Mancha with life-size dinosaurs and many activities

title: (16003) Cuenca - 23 Carretera Alcázar
description:
Gas station with emptying services and the possibility of loading during opening hours. To spend the night without noise and without complications. Fill your diesel tank as a gesture of gratitude so that they continue to let us use the facilities. Water loading problem has been solved, ask the employee.

The black box on the pictures on the right next to the gas station is for your chemical toilet. Right next to it is something that resembles a well (no picture) and if you open the lid you see the water for cleaning and refilling. The grey water is next to the carwash (see picture).

title: (16001) Cuenca - Subida a San Pablo
description: Cerro del Socorro. Cuenca viewpoint. Parking for 10 vans. Quiet night the police passed this morning and said nothing.

title: (16002) Cuenca - Paseo del Jucar
description: Walk along the river, very quiet. And with a good view.

title: (16001) Cuenca - 21 Calle Paz
description: A parking that overlooks the village, an excellent panorama of the mountain. Much traffic in summer. To get there, you pass in front of the cathedral and cross the entire old town, a crossroads with another vehicle can be narrow.

title: (16001) Cuenca - CUV-9144
description: After a few kilometers of forest raft, a second zone on the edge of the track, where the motorhome fits. Very quiet (solitary) with forest for dogs.

title: (16001) Cuenca - 3 CUV-9144
description: Esplanade / Parking with panoramic views of the city to the mountain, has containers. There are usually more caravans. Quiet place. excellent mobile coverage

title: (16002) Cuenca - 3 CM-2105
description: Stop space next to the road with room for two motorhomes. Level ground. No services. Something exposed to the wind.

title: (16002) Cuenca -
description: Calm place to spend the night 100 meters from the road. Climbing sectors can be accessed on foot.

title: (16002) Cuenca - Calle José Merino
description: According to Google maps it is a motorhome area. But it is only a parking lot in a widening of the road where motorhomes fit. No services. Next to the river

title: (16001) Cuenca - Unnamed Road
description: It is a secondary road that you have to climb a good little slope but there are several areas where you can leave the van, nobody comes to say anything (at least to us) the only thing that cars pass but very few, some at the time or something like that. We slept really well

title: (16001) Cuenca - Unnamed Road
description: Place in the middle of nature on the edge of the forest. At the edge of a valley. Absolute calm. Nature in its raw state. Access by stony tracks (4X4 recommended or at a pinch Crossover) more or less rolling depending on the chosen entry point. Last 100 m to find a perfectly flat spot by a skidding path: watch out for stumps and large stones (plan a scout in front of you so as not to be surprised). You will then be 20/30 minutes walk from the Bario de Castillo, the most interesting entry point to the old village of Cuenca (free parking if you prefer to go there with a motor vehicle) a must see. Hiking all around !!!

title: (16002) Cuenca - Camino de San Isidro
description: Flat spot on a bend in a forest track. Quiet, very little passage of hikers. A few noises from the road below. A priori easy access for any vehicle (to be assessed according to your size anyway).

title: (16001) Cuenca - Unnamed Road
description: Little dirt spot next to the road coming from Cuenca's highest area. There are many places like this along the first kilometres of the road: quiet, plenty of shade and with beautiful panoramas of the canyon. The closest ones to the city are frequented by locals that come to see the sunset or have dinner, but at night they're really quiet. The one we hace marked on the map is perfect: shadowy, nice for a walk with your dog and without noises from the road.

title: (16195) Jábaga - Km 174 N-400
description: Nice place of pine forests to spend the night has no services, full of nature surrounded by small chalets quiet place. (a neighbor tells me that there is no problem) basin is 7km more or less

title: (16194) - 16 Calle Encina
description: Sleeping at the gates of Cuenca. Comfortable and flat

title: (16001) Cuenca - CUV-9141
description: On the right side of Cuenca to access the parking lot the next morning to visit the old town. In October, it's quiet. I will be more skeptical in high season. Breathtaking landscape

title: (16194) - 173 N-400
description: Place in a pine tree forest, calm at the beginning of February. But not very clean, in Spanish fashion. All waste remains in nature! :-(. But it's the best place found in Cuenca ..

name: amping Caravaning Cuenca

title: (16191) Cuenca - CM-2105

The beginning of the night was especially entertaining for a gang of children who called and ran away. Then he slept very well.

title: (16193) Cuenca - 66 CUV-5012

title: (16123) Arcas -

title: (16123) Arcas - 61-63 CM-2100

name: El Campichuelo
title: (16143) El Campichuelo
description: Quiet and fenced space to park or spend the night in the middle of nature. It is a strategic place, since it is very close to Cuenca and the mountains and on clear nights it has an impressive sky. We can inform you which places are better to visit depending on your mode of travel because being locals we know the area well. Best access: by the road that leaves the CUV-9116, 800 meters by dirt track. Have a good trip!

name: Fuente del Royo

In summer swimming pool and bar.

Much quieter than at the bottom, as more people walk by and there are usually locals using the barbecues, especially on weekends. If you want to use the barbecues, you can walk down perfectly.

title: (16142) Las Majadas -
description: Quiet place in the middle of nature. As soon as we arrived we saw several deer. The access road has a slight sinkhole, but any small-medium van can fit in without problems. Clay soil (do not enter if it rains or has recently rained). I do not recommend it for larger vehicles since the road has some vegetation spots on the sides and can scratch.

title: (16316) Valdemoro-Sierra - 52D Calle Vaquerizas

description: Picnic, fountain. Barbecues and sheltered tables. Lovely setting We did not make night but it is not indicated that it is not allowed.

description: Quiet area, with shade and drinking water, next to the chapel of Caracenilla, there is no problem to stay there, very quiet place where nobody disturbs you.

title: (16146) Las Majadas - Carretera De Hosquillo

Made with an integral of 7'09 m without problem. The bar is cheap and cosy. Water tap and garbage.

title: () Priego - Unnamed Road
description: On the road from Cañizares to Cañamares (CM-210), before entering the tunnel, take the detour to the right where it says "Puerto de Monsaete". When you enter this road about 350 meters, take the forest track that exits to the right. This track is only accessible for off-road vehicles as it has several steep slopes that a caravan or conventional car cannot climb. At the end of the track there is a fork, take the path to the right until you reach an esplanade, you can sleep there with spectacular views of the Sierra de Priego. The land is well leveled. We had a quiet night with no noise other than birds and cicadas. In addition, on the whole trip, we did not meet any cars or people. It appears to be a trail run only by forest officers.

title: (16812) Albendea -

name: Área de autocaravanas Castillo de Garcimuñoz
title: (16623) Área de autocaravanas Castillo de Garcimuñoz
title_short: (16623) Área de autocaravanas Castillo de Garcimuñoz
description:
Super quiet parking lot, with fresh water filling and gray and black water emptying. At the foot of the castle.

RULES FOR USE OF THE SERVICE AREA FOR CAMPER VANS:

• The maximum parking time is 72 / 96 hours.

• It is forbidden to remove elements such as chairs, tables, grills, awnings, clothes lines, etc. from the motorhome. since it is considered "camping" and the laws of Castilla-La Mancha expressly prohibit free camping.

• The area must be kept in good condition.

• When using the fill and drain terminal, do not spill liquids out of the sink and grate and leave everything clean.

• It is forbidden to wash cars or caravans on the premises.

name: Camping Pantapino
title: (16118) Camping Pantapino
description: Camping is just fine, nothing special. Past his glory days. Showers stay nicely hot, no matter how long you take the shower. Some of the toilets were clogged. WiFi available at reception, just as a bar/restaurant. Parcels are straight, covered with green cloths, as if grass won't grow. Some iron construction for sunscreens is build above, to provide shadow in summer, but not sure if that's still functioning. We didn't see any screens, but it was only April.

title: () -

title: (16879) Beteta - 49 CM-210
description: Lovely picnic area. It has parking separated from the picnic area, fountain and covered barbecue area. No toilet, no electricity. Idyllic setting: forest, river... Ideal if you go with children and/or a dog. It has two entrances and two parking lots that it is easy for you to miss if you are not careful on the road.
